data.title: Remixpoint Increases Cryptocurrency Holdings With Significant Purchase
data.description: According to Foresight News, Japanese publicly traded company Remixpoint announced on February 3, 2025, that it had issued a notice on January 30, 2025, regarding the additional purchase of cryptocurrency assets. During a board meeting held on the same day, the company resolved to acquire a total of 2 billion yen (approximately $12.89 million) in cryptocurrency assets. Following this decision, Remixpoint completed the initial purchase of 500 million yen (approximately $3.22 million) in cryptocurrency on January 31, 2025, acquiring an additional 30.83 BTC. This acquisition has increased the company's total Bitcoin holdings to 509.33 BTC.

data.title: Monad announces testnet will launch this month
data.description: The parallel EVM network Monad announced in X that the testnet will be launched in February 2025.

data.title: Artificial intelligence company Genius Group purchased an additional $2 million in Bitcoin, increasing its reserves to a total of 440
data.description: Odaily Planet Daily News: Artificial intelligence company Genius Group (NYSE American: GNS) announced that it has increased its Bitcoin vault's Bitcoin purchases by an additional $2 million to 440 BTC, with a total value of $42 million and an average price of $95,519 per Bitcoin.

data.title: Japanese listed company Remixpoint increased its holdings by 30.83 BTC, bringing its total Bitcoin holdings to 509.33
data.description: Remixpoint, a Japanese listed company, released its latest announcement on February 3rd, saying that the company had issued an "Announcement on the Additional Purchase of Crypto Assets" on January 30, 2025, and at the board meeting held on the same day, it was decided to purchase additional crypto assets totaling 2 billion yen (about 12.89 million U.S. dollars). According to the resolution, the company completed the purchase of the first batch of 500 million yen (about 3.22 million U.S. dollars) of crypto assets on January 31, 2025, that is, the purchase of 30.83 BTC. The company's current Bitcoin holdings have increased to 509.33.

data.title: US spot Bitcoin ETF had a net outflow of $234.54 million yesterday
data.description: According to TraderT monitoring data, the US spot Bitcoin ETF had a net outflow of US$234.54 million yesterday.

data.title: US spot Ethereum ETF had a net inflow of $83.54 million yesterday

data.title: Coinbase Developer Platform AI Hackathon Announces Winners, DeFAI Project Mamoriko Wins First Prize
data.description: The Coinbase Developer Platform (CDP) AI Hackathon announced the winners, and the DeFAI project Mamoriko won the first prize. It is reported that the project is an AI agent that can find the best returns for USDC on Base and safely optimize the returns of users. The second prize was won by TweetBounty, an AI-driven social media marketing protocol. The Best Infrastructure Award was won by BitMind, a decentralized reputation system that ensures trust, promotes transparency and accountability by verifying AI claims in real time.

data.title: Bitcoin Depot Expands Bitcoin Holdings With $5 Million Purchase
data.description:
According to BlockBeats, on February 4, U.S. Bitcoin ATM operator Bitcoin Depot (NASDAQ: BTM) announced an additional purchase of $5 million worth of Bitcoin as part of its financial strategy, initially revealed in June of last year. With the acquisition of 51 BTC yesterday, the company now holds a total of 71.5 Bitcoins.

Bitcoin Depot is the leading Bitcoin ATM operator in North America, with approximately 8,400 self-service terminals.

data.title: US-listed Bitcoin Depot buys additional $5 million in Bitcoin
data.description: US Bitcoin ATM operator Bitcoin Depot (NASDAQ: BTM) announced that it has purchased an additional $5 million in Bitcoin as part of its financial strategy, which was first announced in June last year. With the purchase of 51 BTC yesterday, the company now holds 71.5 Bitcoins. (Globenewswire)

data.title: Blockchain game studio Midnight Society closes due to financial difficulties
data.description: Midnight Society, the production studio behind the blockchain game Deadrop, has confirmed its closure after facing financial difficulties and internal turmoil. Just a few days before the announcement of the closure of the company, employees received a two-day notice of the company's closure. Previously, co-founder Dr. Disrespect left in mid-2024 due to allegations of misconduct. Although the studio initially expressed confidence in continuing to develop and release Deadrop in 2025, insufficient funds and layoffs ultimately led to its closure. (NFT Plazas)
